com.samskivert.jdbc

Interface Repository.Operation<V>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AutoCloseOperation
    Enclosing class:
    Repository

    public static interface Repository.Operation<V>
    Database operations should be encapsulated in instances of this class and then provided to the repository for invocation. This allows the repository to manage transaction commits for you as well as for it to automatically retry an operation if the connection failed for some transient reason.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      V invoke(Connection conn, DatabaseLiaison liaison)
      Invokes code that performs one or more database operations, all of which will be encapsulated in a single transaction (which can be retried in the event of a transient failure).

    • Method Detail

      • invoke

        V invoke(Connection conn,
         DatabaseLiaison liaison)
  throws SQLException,
         PersistenceException
        Invokes code that performs one or more database operations, all of which will be encapsulated in a single transaction (which can be retried in the event of a transient failure).
        Parameters:
        conn - the database connection on which the operations will be performed.
        liaison - a database liaison for the supplied connection which can be used to determine things for which there is no standard way to determine via JDBC.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if thrown, this will be wrapped in a PersistenceException before being passed up to the operation invoker.
        PersistenceException - can be thrown if something goes awry when executing the operation. Note that the operation will not be retried if a persistence exception is thrown. Such exceptions are assumed to be application specific and not indicative of a basic JDBC failure. The transaction will be rolled back in such cases, however.
